data.title: Cannot read property 'id' of null
data.body:

_Versions_
\- 0.10.13-insider
\- ef2a1fcaa553d14d7731b284a5ac5e4a55c42936
\- 17fa1cbb49e3c5edd5868f304a64115fcc7c9c2c

data.title: ja-JP Too translated default settings.json "window.reopenFolders"
data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.14-insider
  - with ja-JP locale
- OS Version:Windows 10
## Current

```
// 再起動後にフォルダーを再度開かれている方法を制御します。[なし] を選択するとフォルダーを再度開くことはありません。[1 つ] を選択すると最後に作業したフォルダーを再度開きます。[すべて] を選択すると前回のセッションのフォルダーすべてを再度開きます。
```
## Request

```
// 再起動後にフォルダーを再度開かれている方法を制御します。[none] を選択するとフォルダーを再度開くことはありません。[one] を選択すると最後に作業したフォルダーを再度開きます。[all] を選択すると前回のセッションのフォルダーすべてを再度開きます。
```

data.title: How to change vscode language.
data.body: I'm update vscode to insider 0.10.14, Is happy to see vscode support Chinese in UI and comment. But the command translates Chinese too, is hardly to input, because I must change IME to type Chinese. Is any idea to deal this problem?

data.title: [c#] projects.json auto-completion syhould use NuGet.Config

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open project.json e.g. one of these https://github.com/aspnet/cli-samples
2. Copy NuGet.config from the sample repo also
3. Start typing "Microsoft.AspNetCore." and try to autocomplete, it does not give you right entries.

This is maybe because VS Code uses some other way (rather than omnisharp) to autocomplete the project.json. Or the bug is in OmniSharp.

This issue has been checked by other people in here: https://github.com/OmniSharp/omnisharp-roslyn/issues/413

data.title: Multiple cursor paste pastes contents of all cursors
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select something with multiple cursors
2. Cut or Copy.
3. Paste, and you will get the contents of all cursors at each cursor.

Sublime Text must have a clipboard per cursor because it will only paste the text that was selected by that cursor when you copied it.

data.title: Remove all blank lines regex not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 10 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Search and replace with regex turned on: ^$ 
2. Search and replace with regex turned on: ^\s+$

VSC replaces the blank lines with blank lines :)

See more details here:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36350324/visual-studio-code-delete-all-blank-lines-regex

data.title: Add Right-to-Left editing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Please add a feature to change writing direction.
For example, I want to edit markdown documents, and my language is Persian/Farsi, a Right-to-Left language. Now, when I edit documents, always it is left aligned and direction is left-to-right, and it is not comfortable to edit documents that have both Persian text and English text. 

Thanks.

data.title: Should provide option for "Show next statement" to get the current debug point.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When debugging the large app it is common scenario when user lose the current debug point.
To get the current debug point VSCode should provide an option "Show next statement" in the context menu (when user right click on editor).

Like in Visual Studio:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14302630/02d566a4-fb58-11e5-8292-e9870e212ef4.png)

data.title: Getting error in chrome developer tool window when trying to switch between "call stack" items.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open a folder which contains .ts file.
2. Set configuration for launch.json and start debugging.
3. Debug with "Step info (F11).
4. Launch chrome debug window Help->Toggle Developer tools.
4. Click on any item displayed in "call stack" section to verify program flow. 
5. Verify chrome developer tool.

Actual: Getting error messages in chrome developer tool for each click on Call stack item,
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14302370/dd151a16-fb54-11e5-9390-3bb00f8345bc.png)

data.title: TypeScript, string literal, compiler false positive error
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11, 0.10.13-insider, 0.10.14-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10
- TypeScript Version: 1.8.9 locally via tsdk workspace, also occurs with this setting removed.
- Node Version: 4.1.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1) String literal declaration as follows (You can also download the source [here](https://github.com/ibgib/bibleGib)):

```
/** String literal with possible values. Used in place of an enum to allow string type. */
export type RequestType = 'LaunchRequest' | 'IntentRequest' | 'SessionEndedRequest';
export const RequestType = {
    LaunchRequest: 'LaunchRequest' as RequestType,
    IntentRequest: 'IntentRequest' as RequestType,
    SessionEndedRequest: 'SessionEndedRequest' as RequestType
};
```

2) Build the project (ctrl+shift+B) **with the file closed, i.e. not in the edit window**. In my project, I have created a task as follows:

```
{
    // See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
    // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "tsc",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": ["-p", "."],
    "showOutput": "silent",
    "problemMatcher": "$tsc"
}
```

3) The compiler shows that there are multiple errors (for each of the above string literal declarations). When you navigate to the error (thus opening the file in a window), however, the error message disappears. If you compile with the offending file already open (in my case, either helper.ts or alexa-skills-kit.ts), the compiler error does not show at all.

Because it not showing up with the file open in a window, I would think that there is something funky going on with caching and the string literal feature. Possibly a TypeScript issue and not a VS code issue?  I am attaching a screenshot:
![false_positive_compile_error_string_literal](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1253349/14301820/8d7acf30-fb60-11e5-9a36-d9a2bf4a5038.png)

data.title: Intellisense doesn't work with constant function parameters
Intellisense suggestions sometimes based off the last letter typed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start typing any Javascript. I was trying to get console 
2. When typed at the right speed intellisense will sometimes only suggest based off the last letter typed

![intellisenseletter](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14301524/658fb278-fb4d-11e5-873a-9517434fcb53.png)

Sometimes it will be based off the last 2 letters you typed (again dependent of typing speed)
![intellisense2letters](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14301546/96c8b592-fb4d-11e5-8cbb-fc9a91eb8138.png)

There are also suggestions in the list not related to 'con' at the bottom.

data.title: Debugger is crashing when trying to debug with "Step info (F11)"

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open any folder which contains .ts file.
2. Set node debugger and generate launch.json.
3. Update program path to target correct .js file to debug.
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/test.js",
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "preLaunchTask": null,
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "--nolazy"
            ],
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "development"
            },
            "externalConsole": false,
            "sourceMaps": false,
            "outDir": null
        },
1. Now start debugging and once debug options window is showing up keep debugging with
   "Step info (F11)".

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14301215/d9b78a8e-fb4a-11e5-824e-8993776b83ba.png)

*_Actual: *_
1. When I reached to the below line in timers.js and try to debug more then debugger is crashing 
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14301278/490b06ea-fb4b-11e5-8c05-dbcd9d44ec6a.png)
2. Debug options go away and output window displaying message: " Debugger is listening on port 26483").
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14301299/8966e38a-fb4b-11e5-9e3b-421c93e508d1.png)
3. No error message in chrome.

**Expected:**
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14301320/a7e2f0c4-fb4b-11e5-8862-2e1edfdf1ac1.png)

Note: Debugger is working fine for all other options : Continue (F5) , Step Over F(10), Step Out (Shift+F11), Restart and Stop (except "Step info (F11)").

data.title: Getting error while launching "npm" install task from launch.json.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: WIndows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open any folder which contains .ts file.
2. Install eslint extension and restart app.
3. Configure task by generating tasks.json for npm.
4. Update install task as below:
                {
           "taskName": "install",
           "args": ["install","-g","eslint"]
       },
5. Set node debugger and generate launch.json and set prelaunchtask as "install".
6. Start debugging and verify output.

Actual:
1. Getting error " Errors detected while running the preLaunchTask 'install'.
2. There is no error message on output window.
Expected: When I run the command "npm install -g eslint" from command prompt under the workspace folder then I didn't get any error .
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14300760/7ef27e2c-fb47-11e5-8da2-44e04bca4995.png)

data.title: Support dragging instruction pointer during debug

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Visual Studio's Debugger has a really useful feature that lets you drag the instruction pointer around while debugging, it's great for replaying a section if you missed something or skipping over logic that you're not interested in.

![Example](http://i.imgur.com/kuYKGSB.gif)

It would be really nice if this was available in VSCode.

data.title: Test: Include CLI in Linux zip archive and support custom install locations
data.body:
Test - @aeschli

Test plan for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4426
- [x] Test zip archive
- [x] Test .deb package 
- [x] Test .rpm package - 
### .zip test

Extract zip to `~` and attempt to launch with:

```
~/VSCode-linux-x64/bin/code-alpha
```
### .deb/rpm test

Install package and attempt to launch with:

```
code-alpha
# and
/usr/share/code-alpha/bin/code-alpha
```

data.title: Deleting a folder with a modified file shows save changes prompt when exiting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha (latest)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Modify a file in a folder and do not save
2. Delete the folder containing that file
3. Exit VS Code

Actual:
Prompt shows asking if you would like to save the file you deleted within the folder. If you choose yes, when you re-open Code the folder and file will be restored.

data.title: High-contrast theme has ugly serif font on Output dropdown box
data.body: - VSCode Version: 0.10.11 - OS Version: Mac OS X El Capitan We have an ugly serif font and mis-styled dropdown box (light theme and larger dropdown control than normal) in the high contrast theme. Steps to Reproduce: 1. Go to High Contrast Theme 2. Open Output pane

data.title: Do not ask to save for dirty files on delete
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha (latest)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Modify a file and do not save
2. Delete the file

Actual:
Confirmation that you want to delete shows up, then after it asks if you would like to save the file.

Expected:
No confirmation asking if you would like to save after confirming delete.

data.title: Show extension Readme inside code
data.body: Recently I installed an extension with the command palette. Before that I clicked on `Readme` and a new chrome window opened up. How about showing the extension Readme inside VSCode without changing focus/app?

data.title: [javascript] syntax highlighting for class arrow properties is broken
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.14
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Write this code: 

```
class x {
  abc = () =>
    this.func(this.arr.concat(['one 1', 'two 2', 'three 3']));
}
```
1. The syntax higlighting is broken
2. See the image below

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/760112/14296483/02d5767c-fb98-11e5-89fc-51487c19cb1b.png)

data.title: eslint and jshint extensions do not change uninstall to install button after uninstalling
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha (latest)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install jshint and eslint
2. Open install extensions
3. Uninstall either or both. 

Actual:
The uninstall button remains after uninstalling. If you uninstall more than once, the dialog saying you need to restart does not show up.

data.title: Make search files exclusion editable

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Click on the Search icon
2. Unable to modify "files excluded through settings"

Multiple times recently I've wanted to search though node_modules, but because it is disabled in user settings, the only way I can do that is to remove that exclusion in a project specific config, or edit my user settings. 

I get why these defaults exist - but why is that field in the UI read only? I don't want to search node_modules normally - just every now and then, and if I could edit that field that I could temporarily allow it for the search I'm doing right now.

data.title: Extension uninstall "x" is not centered

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha (latest)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open installed extensions 

![uninstallxoffset](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14295554/04775684-fb2b-11e5-8744-e23c86754bff.JPG)

data.title: [javascript] syntax highlighting bug when object property name starts with "var"

data.title: Code Insider does not work on mac
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.15-insider
- OS Version: 10.11.4 (OS X El Capitan)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Download the official website
2. Unzip the file and try to run

data.title: [javascript] Intellisense issues in large JS project
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.14
- OS Version: Windows 10

After I upgraded to 10.13, and soon after to 10.14, the autocomplete is not triggering. At first I thought that by moving away from salsa for javascript projects would have broken something, but reading your blog post gives me the idea that intellisense would still _work_, albeit not as well as with salsa. But then I found out that even simple words _in the same file_ are not showing up when I start typing words.

Is anyone else also facing this issue?

data.title: Auto close feature for command palette should be changed.
data.body:
I personally feel it is annoying when command palette closed automatically without any user action on editor window. It is common use case when user switch focus to the other app and come back to VSCode.
In my case:
1. I generally switch to outlook by clicking on email pop-up alert.
2. When I launch the picker (extension window) and want to read about extension before installing it (moved from VSCode to browser window after clicking on Readme).
- VSCode Version:0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: All

Steps to Reproduce: 
1. Launch app and the press F1 or click on the status bar to open the picker.
2. Now switch focus to other app and come back to VSCode.

Actual: Command palette is auto closed when user switch to the other app.
Expected: Instead of auto close we should allow the user to perform close action by clicking anywhere outside the picker.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14293997/db0f9c68-fb23-11e5-8cb8-4183d9d5484b.png)

data.title: Clipboard access through Extensions API
data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 10, Mac OSX El Captain

Hi, I'm developing [console-wrapper](https://github.com/fabiodamasceno/vscode-console-wrapper) , that is an extension for javascript console.log (other languages support will be added soon) and I need some access for clipboard content in Extensions API. I think this methods should be enough for most of cases:
- vscode.clipboard.getContent()
- vscode.clipboard.setContent()

Some event handlers should be useful, too, like:

-vscode.clipboard.beforeContentLoad()
-vscode.clipboard.onContentLoad()
-vscode.clipboard.onContentLoaded()

Steps for the extension:
- user copy some text;
  - when ctrl+shift+q text is wrapped with console.log and inserted at below line.

hugs,
